properties.title: Construction Notice: Advanced Temporary Road Construction for York University Station
properties.content:
Please visit the Subway News website up-to-date construction notices and information.

Construction Notice No. 8 - Advanced Temporary Road Construction for York U Station

Work begins this month on the second phase of advanced roadway construction on York University’s Keele campus in preparation of York University Subway Station construction, at the east end of the Harry W. Arthurs Common. These temporary roadways will allow transit vehicles to continue to serve the campus throughout the station construction period.

Construction this fall includes:
  • constructing a temporary roadway through York Boulevard Parking lot, connecting Ian MacDonald Boulevard at Vanier Lane with York Boulevard at the signalized intersection of the TTC Busway;
  • bus bay construction on Ian MacDonald Blvd north of Vanier Lane where VIVA, YRT and Brampton Transit (ZUM) buses will be stopping once the construction commences early 2011.
  • sidewalk construction on the north side of Ian MacDonald Blvd in front of the Track and Field Centre.
  • constructing facilities for the relocation of the Welcome Centre from York Boulevard to the northeast corner of The Pond Road and Ian MacDonald Boulevard.
Construction of these facilities is expected to be complete by late December 2010.

properties.title: Security Services
properties.content:
Your York University Campus Security Services department is located in 227 William Small Centre at the Keele Campus and in the Greenhouse at the Glendon Campus. Please visit the York Security website for detailed information on all aspects of campus security. For urgent matters, please call 416.736.5333 or Ex 33333
  • If you observe suspicious persons or situations
  • First aid for non-life threatening incidents
  • When crimes such as thefts have taken place
  • Potential hazards
  • Hate Crime Incidents
For non-urgent matters & service enquiries, please call: 416.650.8000 or Ex 58000
  • Building or room access
  • Minor floods, spills
  • General security information
  • Lost or stolen keys
  • Broken windows, walls or graffiti

properties.title: Temporary Road Construction for York University
properties.content:
Temporary Road Construction (PDF)

Two temporary roadways have been constructed on York University’s Keele campus to accommodate the York University Subway Station construction at the east end of the Harry W. Arthurs Common. These temporary roadways will allow transit vehicles to continue to serve the campus core throughout the station construction period.

The roadway construction work this summer included:
  • building a temporary north-south road through Harry W. Arthurs Common;
  • widening a portion of the south arm of York Boulevard, (south side of the Common) west of Ian Macdonald Boulevard; and
  • constructing a temporary roadway to parallel the south arm of York Boulevard east of Ian Macdonald Boulevard to James Gillies Street (along which traffic will be diverted during the subway station construction).
Construction of these temporary roadways is expected to be completed on September 12, 2010.

properties.title: Counselling and Disability Services
properties.content:
Counselling & Disability Services Glendon Campus Glendon Hall, 111A 2275 Bayview Avenue Toronto, Ontario Canada M4N 3M6
Tel.: 416-487-6709 Email: counselling@glendon.yorku.ca
Glendon Counselling & Disability Services offer confidential, individual appointments to discuss any personal/social concerns that students may have. To make an appointment call 416-487-6709 during office hours (Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.). In addition, workshops on topics such as stress management, procrastination, relaxation etc. are given throughout the year in the Centre. No sign-ups required. After business hours, help is available at the Sunnybrook Hospital Emergency Department located a short distance from Glendon at 2075 Bayview Avenue. See Glendon Counselling & Disability Services  for more information.
